name: browser
description: The fastest, most token-efficient way for AI agents to control Chrome.
readme_summary: This repository provides a command-line interface (CLI) tool for AI agents to control the Chrome browser. It offers fast and token-efficient control over browser actions like navigation, interaction, and content extraction, aiming to be significantly faster than existing solutions.
key_features: Fast and token-efficient Chrome control for AI agents
CLI for browser automation
Commands for browser control, navigation, tab management, interaction, content extraction, screenshots, and debugging
Integration with AI models (e.g., OpenAI Codex, Claude Code)
Experimental but stable commands with evolving output formats for AI effectiveness
primary_use_case: Enabling AI agents to programmatically control and interact with the Google Chrome browser for tasks such as web scraping, automated testing, and information gathering.
cover_image_prompt: A highly intelligent, stylized robot hand seamlessly manipulating a giant, glowing Chrome browser window like a conductor leading an orchestra. The robot hand is precisely guiding elements within the browser, such as clicking buttons and typing text, represented by streams of digital light. On one side, raw data streams (like scrolls or code snippets) feed into the robot, and on the other, structured information (like organized charts or summarized text) flows out from the browser window. The background is a clean, modern digital space with subtle circuit board patterns. The overall mood is efficient and futuristic, emphasizing speed and control. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with vibrant, glowing accents and a focus on clear visual metaphor.

name: sourcegit
description: Windows/macOS/Linux GUI client for GIT users
readme_summary: SourceGit is an open-source, cross-platform GUI client for Git, designed to provide a user-friendly interface for managing Git repositories on Windows, macOS, and Linux. It offers a wide range of Git commands through a visual interface, supports customization, and includes advanced features like GitFlow, Git LFS, and AI-assisted commit message generation.
key_features: Cross-platform support (Windows, macOS, Linux)
Visual Git commands (Clone, Fetch, Pull, Push, Merge, Rebase, etc.)
Customizable themes
Visual commit graph
SSH access support
GitFlow and Git LFS support
AI-generated commit messages
Conventional commit message helper
Create PR on multiple platforms
primary_use_case: To provide a user-friendly graphical interface for interacting with Git repositories, making complex Git operations more accessible to users across different operating systems.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly, anthropomorphic Git robot with a toolbox, standing on a stylized globe representing Windows, macOS, and Linux. The robot is effortlessly organizing and visualizing tangled lines of code (representing Git history) into neat, flowing streams of light. Small, clean UI elements with icons for 'commit', 'branch', and 'push' float around the robot. In the background, subtle digital particles and a faint, glowing commit graph suggest the underlying power. The overall mood is helpful and efficient, with a clean, modern aesthetic. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with bright, clear colors and smooth rendering, emphasizing ease of use and comprehensive functionality.

name: compressO
description: Convert any video into a tiny size.
readme_summary: CompressO is a cross-platform desktop application built with Tauri and Rust that allows users to significantly reduce video file sizes. It leverages FFmpeg for powerful compression and works entirely offline, ensuring user privacy and security.
key_features: Cross-platform desktop app (Linux, Windows, macOS)
Video compression to tiny sizes
Powered by FFmpeg
Built with Tauri and Rust
Offline functionality
primary_use_case: Reducing video file sizes for easier storage, sharing, or streaming.
cover_image_prompt: A whimsical, magical shrinking machine actively pulling large, bulky video files (represented as oversized film reels or digital blocks) into its intake. From the output, tiny, feather-light versions of the videos (represented as small, glowing data packets) are gently floating out. The machine has subtle 'CompressO' branding. The background is a clean, modern workshop with soft, ambient lighting, hinting at a digital creation space. Small, stylized UI elements showing compression progress and file size reduction are visible on the machine's console. The overall style should be a vibrant 3D isometric illustration, emphasizing the transformation from large to small with clear visual contrast and a touch of playful technology.

name: pyversity
readme_summary: Pyversity is a Python library designed to enhance search and retrieval systems by diversifying their results. It efficiently re-ranks lists of similar items to reduce redundancy and surface a wider range of relevant content.
key_features: Fast and lightweight library for result diversification
Implements popular strategies: MMR, MSD, DPP, Cover
Unified and clear API
Minimal dependency (NumPy only)
Tunable diversity parameter for relevance-diversity trade-off
primary_use_case: To improve the quality and variety of results returned by search and retrieval systems by reducing redundancy and increasing diversity.
cover_image_prompt: A vibrant, abstract scene where a single, bright spotlight (representing relevance) illuminates a cluster of nearly identical objects. From the edges of the scene, diverse, colorful streams of light gently push away the redundant objects, revealing a wider array of distinct, yet still relevant, items. Small, subtle UI elements resembling a slider and a diversity score are visible in the background. The overall mood is one of discovery and clarity, with a clean, modern aesthetic. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with soft, glowing effects and a palette of blues, purples, and golds.

name: skyvern
description: Automate browser based workflows with AI
readme_summary: Skyvern is a Python-based tool that automates browser-based workflows using Large Language Models (LLMs) and computer vision. It offers a simple API to replace brittle automation solutions by enabling agents to understand and interact with websites visually, making them resilient to layout changes and capable of handling unseen websites.
key_features: Automates browser-based workflows using LLMs and computer vision
Provides a simple API endpoint for automation
Replaces brittle or unreliable automation solutions
Uses Vision LLMs to learn and interact with websites instead of DOM parsing/XPath
Employs a swarm of agents to comprehend, plan, and execute actions
Operates on unseen websites by mapping visual elements to actions
Resistant to website layout changes
Applies a single workflow to a large number of websites
Leverages LLMs for reasoning through complex interactions and inferring information
primary_use_case: Automating complex, dynamic, and repetitive tasks across various websites without manual coding for each site, by using AI to understand and interact with the visual elements of web pages.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled AI-powered cartographer, represented as a friendly, glowing robot, standing at a crossroads. One path is a tangled mess of broken code and brittle wires (representing traditional automation), while the other is a clear, vibrant path leading to a stylized browser window. The robot is holding a magnifying glass that reveals the visual elements of a website within the browser window, and with its other hand, it's drawing a clear, direct route on a map. Subtle digital particles flow from the robot to the browser, indicating intelligent interaction. The scene is bright and optimistic, with a clean, modern aesthetic. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a focus on clear iconography and a vibrant color palette, emphasizing ease and intelligence.

name: sampler
description: Tool for shell commands execution, visualization and alerting. Configured with a simple YAML file.
readme_summary: Sampler is a Go-based command-line tool that executes shell commands at specified intervals, visualizing their output in real-time through various terminal-based charts and providing alerting capabilities. It's designed as a lightweight alternative to complex monitoring systems for development and quick metric observation.
key_features: Shell command execution with configurable rates
Real-time visualization of command output (runchart, sparkline, barchart, gauge, textbox, asciibox)
Alerting and conditional actions (triggers)
Support for interactive shells and remote server access via SSH
Customizable color themes and component layouts
Simple YAML configuration
primary_use_case: Real-time visualization and monitoring of shell command output for development and quick metric observation, serving as a lightweight alternative to full-scale monitoring systems.
cover_image_prompt: A curious alchemist in a dimly lit laboratory, meticulously pouring streams of raw data (represented as glowing liquid) from various beakers and tubes into a central, intricate contraption. This contraption, subtly shaped like a terminal window, transforms the data into vibrant, dynamic charts and graphs that float in the air around the alchemist. Small, glowing icons representing different chart types (line, bar, gauge) hover near the output. The alchemist is focused, observing the transformation with a magnifying glass. The scene is rich with subtle digital particles and the repository name 'Sampler' is etched onto the contraption. The style is a 3D isometric illustration with a dark, atmospheric mood and glowing, colorful data visualizations.
